website_summaries.verdict: An all-around solid work boot for any job.
pros: These 6-inch Alaska boots will last you quite a while no matter what sort of work you're doing
The tread is great for tricky surfaces as well as for climbing ladders, and the leather uppers look great
cons: These may take some time to break in

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable cat boots
customer_reviews.text: Well I bought this shoe for a friend he had a caterpillar boots before just a slight change in the design. So far he likes it, it's comfortable so will update in a few months regarding the soles etc...the first shoe sole came off in about a year and had to be replaced so will see how long this one last ( he's a mechanic works 6 days a week). I would recommend these to anyone who wants a strong lasting work shoe. PS. The pics were taken after day 2 of being worn however the package came undisturbed and the shoes were new
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and light!
customer_reviews.text: My man loves these boots! He had worn the original Caterillar work boots for as long as he could remember and was very nervous about trying a new style (his former one was discontinued). But he put these on as soon as he got them, and was amazed at how much lighter these were then their predecessor, and how comfortable right off (many boots take time to break in).
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Killion

customer_reviews.title: It's quality Worth every penny of the price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the wide size of 10.5 charcoal one, I'm muscular and this boots are a little bit bulky which i love, i wear them casually and they are so light and comfortable like regular light shoes, it looks just like it's photo, very comfy from the inside and my feet don't sweat in them.
customer_reviews.author: Hoss

customer_reviews.title: Boot
customer_reviews.text: First review: "Well made. Roomy and comfortable for deformed toes. Sturdy. This is a second pair and the first one is still going. Excellent boot! " Second Review: This second pair fell apart within the year. What happened to the quality we came to rely on?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. Been buying these for 20 years or more. A bit stiff but they'll break in. I'd get about a half size larger. A little tight on the sides as they start to wear in. Dont tie them too tight and they'll loosen up. Love them
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Low quality stitching in the heel will lead to shoe becoming broken!
customer_reviews.text: When the shoe came in it fit great and was one of the more comfortable boots I’ve ever worn. However, one month in, and it feels as if the cushion on the bottom of my foot has already been worn down and I can feel the sole putting pressure on my arch. Also, the stitching on the heel inside the shoe tore off, which means that it is going to be a quick decline to the entire inside of the shoe becoming unstitched. Buyer beware this is not a high quality shoe
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing the regular Alaska’s for over 20 years. These fit the same and are a little more comfortable. They are a bit lighter as well. I don’t know if they are as durable but so far they are great.
customer_reviews.author: P Witty

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BOOTS!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots I have worn the Alaskan's for about 7 years, been through about 5 or 6 pairs wearing them everyday to work. When the time came to replace my old boots I decided to try the 2.0 this time these are very close to the original Alaskan but lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Amber J

customer_reviews.title: Great CAT workboot
customer_reviews.text: It was not hard to choose the size of the CAT boot since this is the only boot my husband will wear. He is a General Contractor / residential construction and is in the sometimes harsh elements of our NE Ohio weather. He just loves these boots. They outlast any boot he has ever owned. He does not like steel toes so it becomes difficult to get a high quality commercial grade boot without spending hundreds of dollars. This is the answer, we highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Bou

customer_reviews.title: seems like a good quality boot for the price in todays world.
customer_reviews.text: product arrived on time and in very good condition. I tried my new boots on and was very happy with fit. I have now worn them all day long today and they are just great. seller is A+ with description and promised shipping times. now to see if boots hold up to everyday use. if they do not , then it is not sellers fault. he sells them, he does not make them.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE WEST or KAY WEST

customer_reviews.title: These fit just like the 1
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical to order these. The 1.0 versions were all I wore fore the last 10 years doing construction. These fit just like the 1.0s and I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Vonbaronmattso

customer_reviews.title: misrepresentation: Product is not as described.
customer_reviews.text: Product is not as described. Box states size is: 13 wide. Shoe is labeled: 13 M (for medium)
customer_reviews.author: Home chef

customer_reviews.title: Thinking insulation than the brown colored Alaskans
customer_reviews.text: I have the Alaskans in brown in size 11 and they fit great. I ordered an 11 in the charcoal and they had to be returned for a 12.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They seem to be just as good as the original Alaska boots
customer_reviews.text: I was having a hard time finding the "Alaska" ones that were not steel toe until I found these. They seem to be just as good as the original Alaska boots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money and Amazon did not stand behind th hem like ebay would!
customer_reviews.text: Boot only lasted 2 weeks before the started falling apart. Then when I contacted Amazon they did nothing for me. The boots lasted 4 months and Now are unwearable and messed my feet up don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Rich 84

customer_reviews.title: In my line of work the laces don't last but boots do
customer_reviews.text: Only boot I will own anymore. Decent price. In concrete business and they last twice as long as any other I've worn. Comfy too
customer_reviews.author: Rhett Major

customer_reviews.title: Solid, very light boot.
customer_reviews.text: Toe box on the tighter side but not overly so. Well made boot for the price. Nice solid shank in there which I appreciate for support for being on my feet all day.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great boot worth the maoney
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my 2nd pair looking for my 3rd. I still have my first pair still in OK condition and still wear for like mowing lawn and gardening etc. I do polish my boots once in awhile. First pair I've had for 2 1/2 years and I've got a year on my current boots. I was skeptical at first, I mean Caterpillar boots? I paid $120 for my first pair. I have a few problems with my feet and these are comfortable and I've had no problems with them.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: 3 month review.
customer_reviews.text: Theese boots are very comfortable and when new look great. I’ve had them a total of 3 months the support is shot and the toes are worn through. The treads still great. I allowed one pair of boots a year. Not 4. There’s no way Theese will make it.
customer_reviews.author: dustin

product_meta.title: Caterpillar Men's Alaska 2.0 / Brown Industrial & Construction Shoe
product_meta.description:
One of our rebuild Originals styles. The alaska was one of our most popular styles. We've added more comfort and style to this iconic work boot.

As the world's foremost manufacturer of heavy equipment, Cat earthmovers are known around the world as a symbol of honest work, strength and integrity. Cat Footwear makes boots and shoes based on these same principals. The brand has evolved from work boots into a range of industrial and casual footwear built with the sole purpose of staying true to their original goal--creating genuine, hard-working boots and shoes.
